entries.meaning: (rare) A small or petty person, creature or object, especially a fairy, dwarf, imp, or elf.
examples: "Yes," said the pigwidgeon who had spoken before. "We will do that, for we are very anxious to know how to divide five-sevenths by six. We have been working at it for four or five days, and there wont be anything worth dividing if we wait much longer." The pidwidgeons now began to descend the vine;  […]

entries.meaning: (rare) A contemptible or stupid person or creature.
examples: "Fie, then, naughty child" cried madame;  […]  But the great orator chuckled with laughter.
"Pigwidgeon, pigwidgeon!" he said, nodding his head at the culprit. "Not for youth and health are rouge and enamel, and all the vestments of vanity."
